thread.title: Crystal Palace thugs accidentally vandalise WRONG team bus in shocking mix-up
thread.title_full: Crystal Palace thugs accidentally vandalise WRONG team bus in shocking mix-up

title: Crystal Palace thugs accidentally vandalise WRONG team bus in shocking mix-up
text:
TWITTER ATTACK: The team bus after it was daubed with graffiti on Friday night “£40,000 worth of damage on our coach thinking it was the Boro coach. Nice one! #cpfc” Dean Waters 
The two teams met on Saturday in a crucial Premier League relegation six-pointer. 
However the south London club's win was overshadowed by the antics of a small group of Palace supporters. 
The words "Crystal Palace FC" were sprayed onto the side and rear of a coach parked outside a hotel often used by away sides visiting Selhurst Park. 
GETTY TOUGH: Crystal Palace have suffered a nightmare season 
The club's assistant head groundsman Dean Waters later revealed the bus was actually owned by Palace. 
The vandals have reportedly cost their own club a sum of £40,000. 
He tweeted: "£40,000 worth of damage on our coach thinking it was the Boro coach. Nice one! #cpfc." 
He has since made his account private. Liverpool board brand new team bus ahead of Chelsea clash Tuesday, 31st January 2017 LIVERPOOL have a got a brand new team bus - and it stands out from the crowd! 1 / 10
